intro: Eggelingia clavata, commonly known as the clustered liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming liverwort that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology with a leafy stem and clustered leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. Its structure consists of a thallus, which is a simple, undifferentiated body made up of photosynthetic cells. Eggelingia clavata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
